document.masterDocTitle: A revision of the genus Drasteria of Central Asia and Kazakhstan with special attention to the adjacent areas (Lepidoptera: Erebidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A revision of the genus Drasteria of Central Asia and Kazakhstan with special attention to the adjacent areas (Lepidoptera: Erebidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material.
Lectotype male ( designated here in accordance with ICZN Art. 74) ( Figs. 40–42 ), labelled: “Saisan | Hbhr.” (brown paper, handwritten), “Origin.” (pink paper, printed), “ex coll. 1/7 | Staudinger” (white paper, printed with handwritten numbers), “ LECTOTYPUS | Leucanitis obscurata | Staudinger, 1882 | Stettin ent. Ztg 43: 55 | Korb, Matov, Volynkin des. |
2016, Feb. 1–4
” (red paper, printed) ( ZMHU )
.
Paralectotypes 6 males , 4 females ( ZMHU )
.
Habitat ( Figs. 305–309 , 316, 317 ). Steppes, deserts and semideserts. Elevation: 200–2000 m .

Distribution . South-East Kazakhstan (Saisan and environs, Saur and Tarbagatai, Dzhungar and Boro-Khoro), North, Inner and West Tian-Shan. The record of this species from North-West Kazakhstan ( Uvarov, 1910 ) most likely is erroneous.

Material examined (in total: 239).
